attributes.action: Will the Government commit to allowing free and fair local elections in 2026?
attributes.additional_details: Will the Secretary of State announce in Parliament that they will not use their powers under the Local Government Act 2000, or any other method to delay, impede or otherwise cancel the planned Local Elections on May 7 2026?
attributes.background: One hundred years after the right to vote was granted to all adults in the United Kingdom this right is being eroded. Last year a wide number of local elections were postponed.  There is a strong chance the Government will do the same this year. This will be the longest delay since WWII.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petitions, which call for similar action:

Remove power to cancel local government elections
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/747234

Stop the cancellation of Local Elections to help uphold democracy
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/751384
